preqs: OHS1000 and a pass in 24 credit points of studio unit at level 1; enrolment in an approved Faculty award.  Students must obtain approval from their Course Coordinator.
description: The interdisciplinary studio environment provides through team-based project activities and problem-based learning, the application of knowledge, techniques and methodologies from the students' individual disciplines, whilst addressing a complex multi-faceted problem. The unit may involve any combination of art, design or architecture students. The ability to critically and creatively engage with 'real world' problems through interdisciplinary approaches will be the core of this unit. Students will develop skills in communication, collaboration and innovation, essential tools for both professional practice and research activities within their chosen field and beyond. The final outcomes from the unit may be collaborative or individual.
faculty: Faculty of Art, Design and Architecture
